abstract: Los Angeles County officials announce federal immigration officials will be allowed limited access to county jails, change to policy that had denied them access in order to protect immigrants from deportation; change may signal broader shift away from protecting immigrants, likely influenced by two high-profile murders allegedly committed by illegal immigrants.
lead_paragraph: In a change that may reflect a broader shift in California, federal immigration officials will be allowed back inside Los Angeles County jails to identify some inmates for deportation.

headline.main: Los Angeles County Rethinks Deportation of Inmates
headline.print_headline: Los Angeles Rethinks Deportation of Inmates

snippet: In a change that may reflect a broader shift in California, federal immigration officials will be allowed back inside Los Angeles County jails to identify some inmates for deportation.
